Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Plantaricin DL3 (natural AMPs; bacteriocins; Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes)
Sequence Information.Source: lactic acid bacteria, probiotic,Lactiplantibacillus plantarum; (old)Lactobacillus plantarumDL3

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of the peptide shows 45% similarity tofrog Peptide A1.Activity: inhibition zone: Active against both Gram+ L. monocytogenes 19115 (>18 mm); S. aureus 26003 (10-14 mm); B. cereus 63301 (14-18 mm) and Gram- bacteria P. fluorescens (14-18 mm); P. mendocina (14-18 mm); S. putrefaciens (14-18 mm); A. hydrophila (10-14 mm); Psychrobacter sp. 00052 (>18 mm); S. typhimurium 26003 (10-14 mm); E. coli (10-14 mm), esp. P. aeruginosa (>18 mm).Antimicrobial robustness: It has high thermal stability (15 min, 121 °C) and narrow pH stability (pH 2.5–5.5). Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Lv X, Lin Y, Jie Y, Sun M, Zhang B, Bai F, Zhao H, Li J. 2018
Literature Information.Title: Purification, characterization, and action mechanism of plantaricin DL3, a novel bacteriocin against Pseudomonas aeruginosa produced by Lactobacillus plantarum DL3 from Chinese Suan-Tsai.
